oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Oat varieties for organic systems
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Fradgley, Nick
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Production systems
Cereals, pulses and oilseeds
Weed management
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Oats are valuable crop in organic rotations owing to their good nutrient use efficiency and weed competitive ability. Although Leaf Area Index is linked to height, varieties with high LAI but short height would confer good weed suppression with less risk of lodging.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Fradgley, Nick (2013) Oat varieties for organic systems. Poster at: Cereals 2013 , Boothby Graffoe, Lincolnshire, 12-13 June . [Completed]
